intro: Bradburya conjugata, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Bradburya conjugata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
